events.name: Italy Imposes Windfall Tax on Banks
events.wd_label: Italy Imposes Windfall Tax on Banks
events.wd_description: Italy has imposed a one-off windfall tax on local banks to address the extra profits they have made from rising interest rates, with proceeds to support mortgage holders and cut taxes.
events.description: Italy has imposed a one-off windfall tax on local banks to address the extra profits they have made from rising interest rates, with proceeds to support mortgage holders and cut taxes.

events.name: Tax Approval
events.wd_description: The Italian government approved the windfall tax in a cabinet meeting, planning to use the proceeds to support mortgage holders and reduce taxes.
events.description: The Italian government approved the windfall tax in a cabinet meeting, planning to use the proceeds to support mortgage holders and reduce taxes.

events.name: Rationale Behind the Tax
events.wd_description: Deputy Prime Minister Matteo Salvini highlighted that banks' profits in the first half of 2023, driven by the European Central Bank’s rate hikes, justify the tax.
events.description: Deputy Prime Minister Matteo Salvini highlighted that banks' profits in the first half of 2023, driven by the European Central Bank’s rate hikes, justify the tax.

events.name: Expected Revenue
events.wd_description: The government plans to tax 40% of the extra income stream from rising interest rates, with an estimated revenue of up to €4.9 billion from Italy's 10 largest publicly listed banks.
events.description: The government plans to tax 40% of the extra income stream from rising interest rates, with an estimated revenue of up to €4.9 billion from Italy's 10 largest publicly listed banks.

events.name: Analysts' Reaction
events.wd_description: Equity analysts, including Jefferies, noted that the decision to tax the net interest margin was unexpected.
events.description: Equity analysts, including Jefferies, noted that the decision to tax the net interest margin was unexpected.

events.name: Deadly Blast in Kostyantynivka, Ukraine
events.wd_description: A blast in a busy market street in Kostyantynivka, Ukraine, has killed at least 17 people and injured 33 others. President Volodymyr Zelensky condemned the attack, blaming Moscow.
events.description: A blast in a busy market street in Kostyantynivka, Ukraine, has killed at least 17 people and injured 33 others. President Volodymyr Zelensky condemned the attack, blaming Moscow.

events.name: Details of the Blast
events.wd_description: The blast occurred on a busy market street in Kostyantynivka in the middle of the day, hitting a market, pharmacy, and shops.
events.description: The blast occurred on a busy market street in Kostyantynivka in the middle of the day, hitting a market, pharmacy, and shops.

events.name: President Zelensky's Condemnation
events.wd_description: President Volodymyr Zelensky condemned the attack, calling it a deliberate attack on the peaceful city of Kostyantynivka and blaming Moscow.
events.description: President Volodymyr Zelensky condemned the attack, calling it a deliberate attack on the peaceful city of Kostyantynivka and blaming Moscow.

events.name: Casualties and Injuries
events.wd_description: At least 17 people were killed and 33 others were injured in the blast, with the death toll expected to rise.
events.description: At least 17 people were killed and 33 others were injured in the blast, with the death toll expected to rise.

events.name: Investigation Launched
events.wd_description: The Prosecutor-General of Ukraine has launched an investigation into the incident, pursuing criminal proceedings for violation of the laws and customs of war.
events.description: The Prosecutor-General of Ukraine has launched an investigation into the incident, pursuing criminal proceedings for violation of the laws and customs of war.

events.name: Russia Ends Grain Deal with Ukraine
events.wd_label: Russia Ends Grain Deal with Ukraine
events.wd_description: Russia has confirmed that it will not renew the grain deal with Ukraine, accusing the West of not fulfilling its obligations under the agreement.
events.description: Russia has confirmed that it will not renew the grain deal with Ukraine, accusing the West of not fulfilling its obligations under the agreement.

events.name: Russia's Conditions for Return
events.wd_description: Russia has stated that it would return to the grain deal if its conditions, particularly regarding the export of Russian food, are met.
events.description: Russia has stated that it would return to the grain deal if its conditions, particularly regarding the export of Russian food, are met.

events.name: Western Accusations
events.wd_description: U.S. Secretary of State Antony Blinken accused Russia of using the grain deal as a weapon, and Ukraine's Foreign Minister Dmytro Kuleba criticized Russia for undermining the grain initiative.
events.description: U.S. Secretary of State Antony Blinken accused Russia of using the grain deal as a weapon, and Ukraine's Foreign Minister Dmytro Kuleba criticized Russia for undermining the grain initiative.

events.name: Impacts on Grain Prices
events.wd_description: The end of the grain deal is expected to increase grain prices worldwide, according to Ukraine's Foreign Minister Dmytro Kuleba.
events.description: The end of the grain deal is expected to increase grain prices worldwide, according to Ukraine's Foreign Minister Dmytro Kuleba.

events.name: Canada-Japan Cooperation on Battery Supply Chains
events.wd_label: Canada-Japan Cooperation on Battery Supply Chains
events.wd_description: Canada and Japan have agreed to work more closely together to establish sustainable and reliable global battery supply chains.
events.description: Canada and Japan have agreed to work more closely together to establish sustainable and reliable global battery supply chains.

events.name: Memorandum of Cooperation
events.wd_description: Canada and Japan signed a memorandum of cooperation to strengthen their collaboration on global battery supply chains during a visit by Japanese Industry Minister Yasutoshi Nishimura.
events.description: Canada and Japan signed a memorandum of cooperation to strengthen their collaboration on global battery supply chains during a visit by Japanese Industry Minister Yasutoshi Nishimura.

events.name: Canada's Green Technology Initiative
events.wd_description: Canada aims to attract firms involved in all levels of the electric vehicle (EV) supply chain through a multibillion-dollar green technology initiative.
events.description: Canada aims to attract firms involved in all levels of the electric vehicle (EV) supply chain through a multibillion-dollar green technology initiative.

events.name: Mining Sector Development
events.wd_description: Canada is home to a large mining sector for minerals such as lithium, nickel, and cobalt, which are critical for battery production.
events.description: Canada is home to a large mining sector for minerals such as lithium, nickel, and cobalt, which are critical for battery production.

events.name: New Facility in Quebec
events.wd_description: A unit of South Korea's Solus Advanced Materials announced it would build a copper foil facility in Quebec, producing technology for EV batteries.
events.description: A unit of South Korea's Solus Advanced Materials announced it would build a copper foil facility in Quebec, producing technology for EV batteries.
